content: bishi a knitting pattern by georgie nicolson bishi is a simple seamless knitted water bottle carrier that is perfectly practical for everyone knit in the round from the bottom up there are two options for finishing the handles either garter stitch strap or a stocking stitch strap which can be tied and easily shortened or lengthened to suit the mesh lace is super-dooper stretchy and will fit everything from a boutique beer to a nice chunky water bottle a great stashbuster or gift knit the whole project can be knit in a couple of hours and requires less than a ball of yarn skill level intermediate 2 | bishi sizing abbreviations one size fits most dpns double pointed needles k knit the strap s length can easily be adjusted depending on your k2tog knit 2 stitches together taste and the recipient p purl sm stitch marker sor start of round yarn requirements st/s stitch/es lily sugar n cream the original 100% cotton 120yd yo yarn over 110m /70g - 1 ball or 10ply/worsted weight cotton of 70 to 80 yards/65 to 75 useful links metres approximately emily ocker s cast on http //www spellingtuesday com/circular_co html the striped version has been knit with anchor style magicline alternatively you may wish to try techknitter s disappearing loop method gauge http //techknitting blogspot com au/2007/02/casting-on- not particularly crucial as the lace mesh section is extremely from-middle-disappearing html stretchy and accommodating but for the base 21 to 22 stitches per 4 inches/10cm on us6/4mm needles is grafting garter stitch recommended http //www youtube com/watch v=baeiogili6o knitting i-cord needles and notions http //www knittinghelp com/video/play/i-cord-english usg/4mm crochet hook us6/4mm set of 4 double pointed needles dpns or your preference for small circumference knitting us7/4 5mm 12 /30cm circular needle or your preference for small circumference knitting eg dpns or magic looping darning needle one stitch marker safety pin or split ring marker optional construction bishi begins in the middle of the base with a circular cast-on after increasing to work the base the body of the bottle holder is knit in round using a simple mesh pattern two options for straps are provided with both finished off by simply tying them together © georgie nicolson 2013 all rights reserved bishi | 3 the base using your crochet hook cast on 8 sts using emily ocker s this will give you three ridges of garter stitch cast- on next round cast off 11 sts k4 transfer the sts to your us6/4mm dpns distributing sts evenly this will give you 5 live sts around three needles beginning the cast-off process again cast off another 11 sts round 1 knit pulling the tail tight at the end of the round making sure you leave the 5 sts intact place sm to indicate sor or mark the first st with a safety pin or split ring marker k4 again you will have 5 live sts round 2 *k1 yo repeat from * until end of round 16 sts
